content.description: Stop and have a picnic is the obvious trad line that is on the far right side of Picnic Area Left. Follow a great selection of hand jams, stems and laybacks up a great line.
Poly-Ticks is a great sporty line that starts about 6ft to the left of Stop and have a picnic and goes up the white rock through a small roof then up the headwall to the top.

Blood Diamond is about 6ft to the left of Poly-Ticks and about 8ft to the left of Abba. About 10ft up you should see an obvious diamond shaped rock jutting about 4 inches out from the wall around it. Climb up to it, move very slightly to the left past a small roof through good holds to a small dyno and finish on decent holds.

Abba is located on Picnic Area Left. The route starts in the middle of the wall, about 12 feet to the right of a muddy stain where water exits a crack in the wall.  

  Climb up some thin holds through two small roofs. After pulling the second small roof follow a nice layback for a few moves through some more smallish holds to the top.
content.protection: Currently TR only. Bolts will be added soon.

content.description:
This is the best of the three Picnic walls. It is the steepest (just past vertical) wall, the cleanest wall and the best climbing (IMHO) in all of Section 18.

 A 50 foot high, by 150 wide wall that is dry and clean, something not usually found in the UP. Perfect crimps and face holds and a complete lack of cracks make this an extremely fun sport climbing zone.
